result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Thomas Vitrano was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Also advised if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guioly or no contact for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his county or denied naturalization under Federal law.

No alcohol.  No controlled substances without a valid presription.

Pay all supervision fees, to make regular monthly payments.

AODA assessment and compliance with any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random drug tests and breathalyzers.  Defendant shall be tested once per month for the entire term of probation.

supervisions.notes: Fine of $350.00 plus all mandatory costs, penalties, surcharges and $50.00 ignition interlock surcharge.  To be paid while on probation on count one. To make regular monthly payments.  Failure to pay is civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
To commence upon eligibility to reinstate license.
Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan signed.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Thomas Vitrano

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony Thomas Vitrano in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Anthony Thomas Vitrano in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. 

AS TO THE AMENDED INFORMATION:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court sentenced defendant to serve 1 YEAR in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence.  Defendant to be released only to the day reporting center.  Not to be served on electronic monitoring.  Court gives credit for 11 days served. 

Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 MONTHS, with the following conditions:

PROBATION CAN BE TRANSFERRED TO ANOTHER COUNTY.

- Serve 30 DAYS UP FRONT CONDITION TIME CONSECUTIVE, in the House of Correction.  No good time credit. 
- 60 DAYS, IMPOSED and STAYED, CONSECUTIVE in the House of Correction to be used by the agent for any violations.  Defendant shall serve 10 days for the first violation, 20 days for the second violation, and 30 days for the third violation.  Defendant shall then be revoked.
- Complete a mental health evaluation and comply with all recommended treatment.
- Advise any doctor of this case.
- AODA assessment and compliance with any recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests and breathalyzers.  Defendant shall be tested once per month for the entire term of probation.
- Seek and maintain full time employment.
- No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
- Complete a anger management class, if recommended by agent.
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, while on probation.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.
- Pay all supervision fees.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.

AS TO COUNT 2:
Court ordered defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, CONSECUTIVE with any other sentence, with credit for 90 days time served.  

TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered defendant to pay a fine of $350.00 plus all mandatory costs, penalties, surcharges, and $50.00 ignition interlock surcharge, while on probation on count 1.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.  Court ordered AODA assessment and Driver's Safety Plan.  Defendant to cooperate with any treatment recommended.  Court ordered defendant's driving privileges revoked for a period of 1 YEAR.  Court orders defendant restricted to operation of vehicles equipped with an ignition interlock device for 1 YEAR to commence upon eligibility to reinstate license.  

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Order for IDP related offense driver assessment and driver safety plan;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.  aw

Received and filed.  aw

Count 1:  Possession of narcotic drugs, contrary to WI Stats sec. 961.41(3g)(am), 939.50(3)(i).  A class I felony.

Count 2:  Operating with restricted controlled substance in blood- 2nd and subsequent offense, contrary to WI Sec. 346.63(1)(am), 346.65(2)(am)2.  A unclassifed misdemeanor.  aw

Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 6/17/2015 at 8:30 am.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
FILED, NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION FOR REDUCTION OF BAIL
All other conditions remain as set.

Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court, defendant Anthony Thomas Vitrano not in court, in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 4/22/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony Thomas Vitrano in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Anthony Thomas Vitrano in custody.  Hanna Kolberg for Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Anthony Thomas Vitrano in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Anthony Thomas Vitrano in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
